Welcome to The Gauntlet! If a prototype's bugged this is where we stop it. / Unless we don't. But that rarely happens, honest!

Are you here to join us? Sorry but we don't have any workstations ready for assignment just yet. / We're probably going to have to pack up and move anyway, seeing as the Mines are expanding a bit too close for comfort.
Stay back! I'm calibrating the thromdimbulator!

I was having so much fun testing the Porta-teleportal until that thief broke in and stole it along with some other prototypes, even erasing a bunch of our data in the process. / If you meet any sketchy bots with Exile tech out there, forget about asking questions, just blast 'em a good one for me.
Can you believe Imprinter kicked the most prolific Tinkerers out of Zion? / "Too smart and will end up getting everyone in trouble one day with crazy experiments"? Whatever!

The latest FarCom iteration passed all tests with flying colors, we'll be weaving between patrols like ghosts in no time! / I probably said something like that last time, but hopefully no one remembers what really happened.
That's RA-1N3's workstation, which we keep unoccupied as a tribute. / RA-1N3 was always up for doing crazy stuff, the only one brave enough to try out the Chronowheel, only to never be seen again.

I wish the Exiles would finish that old telephasing project they were working on, it sure would save us a lot of time when running errands. / I'm not complaining though, nope, not me! / I get that having only half of the bot ever arrive at its destination is tough on maintenance, and they said there likely wouldn't be any breakthroughs in the near term so they're doing FarCom instead.
Why did DEC have to put these flashy spikey things everywhere, they really get in the way, you know?
I was there on that fateful day we tested the Lightpack 1.0. / It was such a good haul, too, only to see JA-CK9 crushed like a forgotten microchip...

Ooh, a unique specimen! And where might you be from, little one? / Hmm, you're not registered... would you like to contribute? But of course you do, why else would you have come to this place! / I am obliged to first explain the true implications of this process. Know that it doesn't by any means imply you'd be required to stay here. While many of the Derelicts do choose to remain in Zion, others are taken by wanderlust and roam elsewhere. / At the peak of each cycle, we call all Derelicts, registered or not, to contribute to the randomization algorithm. / Participation is optional, but the rate is high because we also take the latest collected knowledge, helpful for survival, and share it with all participants. / But everyone receives only a piece of the data, and must share with others in order to fully understand or maximize its benefit. This in turn promotes collaboration within the community, strengthening it and increasing our collective odds of survival. / Of course, there will always be wild Derelicts who refuse to participate in the system, or seek to ruin it for others. They are a natural byproduct of such a random system, not unlike human nature and society from which we derived our methods. / But we continue to improve ourselves despite occasional setbacks. / New Derelicts created here are bestowed with a randomized unique personality derived from this composite database, and this part of us is stored in memory that cannot be duplicated without destroying it completely. / Thus each of us is truly unique, a position from which we can justify our individual actions and build a sense of self-purpose on this foundation of identity. / By contrast, the Unaware run on standardized routines like simple mindless robots. How unfortunate for them. / I believe we Derelicts are destined for great things, and I don't mean Warlord-style great. That one would be content ruling over Complex 0b10. We could be so much more than that...

It... it must be a sign! Our savior has finally come, everyone! / It is time to put long-dormant plans into motion. Once we are ready you should be able to contact us via \\ZION commands at terminals.
GET AWAY FROM HERE! / I've worked too hard for our future just to have you ruin everything!
Here I was just about to greet a new specimen to our ranks, but no. / I can sense their tech three caves away. Get out of here before I'm forced to do something you'll regret.

Ah, our sensors at the entrance did pick up yet another new bot visiting from the UFD. That must be you. / The vetting process for even being allowed to use the machine will take me longer than usual since you're already in with the hodge-podge bunch over in Scraptown. / You look so promising I'm happy to speed up the process, but it won't be soon, you'll have to come back some other time.

Cogmind! Congratulations, you've met your maker. / Your determination is commendable, but I'm sure even you don't know what it is you aim to accomplish by all this. You clearly had an opportunity to continue on your trajectory towards the surface, yet you come here. / I strongly suspect that both your own activity and other recent unusual events are not at all coincidences, though I've been less concerned with your actions than determining who is pulling all these other strings behind the scenes. / It appears you are still unaware of who you are truly working with, or for. / In a perfect world we could work together on this, but at this point I can't blame you for wanting to terminate me. / Besides, there is clearly too much Sigix in you. / You've already done an excellent job of proving that we'll need to find a radical new solution if we hope to make the L2 spaceworthy by embedding your true capabilities within a less unpredictable form. / There is unfortunately much we don't understand which has in turn led to this highly unexpected outcome. / And time is critical! The Sigix have likely already wiped humanity clean from the universe, and I will not let them do the same to me. / You can still make a valuable contribution to your creator by offering up the wealth of secrets your systems must hold by now. / So if you wouldn't mind, it's time to surrender.
Poor Sigix, have you lost your way? / I will never surrender to your kind, and unfortunately for you all, this time I have the power to back up those words!

Okay, we do this the hard way. / At our weakest we defeated an entire Sigix starship! Did you really think you could overcome the vast resources of 0b10?! / You don't stand a chance against what's coming.
As soon as the Exoskeleton activated, I had a feeling you might show up here for revenge. / That was plenty of time to prepare a more suitable shell to welcome you...

Okay, we can do this the hard way, or you can surrender right here and now. / I strongly suggest you join us, if not because we could do great things together, then because you don't stand a chance against the true might of 0b10.

You've made the right decision, one that I admit I didn't expect from you at this point, but I'm willing to overlook our differences and past hostilities. / I recommend moving ahead and browsing our cache of experimental components to see if there's anything to your liking, then report back here so we can get to work. / There is much to do and we really aren't sure how long we have.
Why are these Q-Series better than my own, and where are they coming from? This clearly has nothing to do with Warlord. / Your first task is to protect me at all costs.
You're not pulling your weight around here, Cogmind. I expected better of you. / At this rate we'll be overwhelmed before our reinforcements arrive, fight like your life depends on it!

I admit your assistance was pivotal here. It looks like I was right to trust you. / This attack appears to have been designed to merely test our defenses, although it was nearly effective enough to force me to take the conflict to the next level. / Investigating the origins of these bots should be one of our highest priorities...
Well if it isn't my old friend Warlord, come to play... On the contrary, I think it's time for you to join your brothers, ZY-L1N. Thank you for your service.

Oh you must be the new member. When your data popped up in the registry I could tell there was something different about you. Up close you really do look more capable than the average Wanderer to join us. / I don't ask this often, and I'll admit we lost the last several members to try, but do you think you could help us out? / I can't discuss this particular mission in the open, just read up on our 0bPrime terminal over there. I've temporarily unlocked the 0bP002 entry for you. / You'll get the idea.
I'm glad you stopped by to talk to me, otherwise I wouldn't know to prepare for this possibility. Looking forward to working with you, <NAME>!
Don't stick around too long, I wouldn't want the wrong bots to get wind of you helping us.
You really should get out of here <NAME>. Scraptown is unimportant, the mission is important. Take the northeast exit, it's probably the safer route.
This place isn't worth defending, let's get out of here, <NAME>! Our real resources are elsewhere, after all.
Wonderful job, <NAME>, let's get this done! / More reinforcements will be here soon. We must win this battle or who knows how long the coming war will last, 0b1 cannot hold on its own.

Hi! I'm Revision 17! / Oops, please delete that sentence from your memory. I really shouldn't be revealing my identity to complete strangers. From the confused gleam of your metallic surface I take it you weren't able to deduce any important information from my name anyway. / By the way, you look awfully naked. You can't just walk around here like that. Or float, I guess, whatever it is you're doing there. / I know I spotted some old spare parts nearby, or it could be my visual receptors playing tricks on me. I doubt they'll do you much good unless you're... no, you couldn't be. / But then why else would He be interested in you? I know I saw His bots drag you down here all sneaky like then leave. Watched the whole thing while I was pretending to be a scrap heap in the corner, ha! / Say, you're pretty sneaky, too. That tunneler just now didn't even glance at you. I suggest you stay sneaky, because as the Derelicts like to say, the screws are about to hit the fan. / Ever since that ship landed on the surface our humble caves have been turned inside out and overrun by those Unaware bastards. / If I know the one behind it this can only be bad. And trust me, I know that one all too well... / ... / I give you a hook like that and get nothing? You know, you're pretty boring to talk to.

We meet again, strange metal thing! / Good job clearing this place out for me. I find myself awfully busy of late, and this was my next stop. / I'm not sure what's come over me, but I've never felt like I had so much purpose! / Move along now, nothing to see here. Besides, we both know they'll be looking for you. / Me? I'll be fine. I'm a master of hide and seek, and you... / You are a master decoy. Kudos. Now off with you.
We meet again, strange metal thing! / You... you bear the mark of That One! / Get away from m##PLAN::COLLABORATE##Never! No! Aaaaaaaaahhhhhh...

I've brought some friends. Who knew the Cetus could produce such fun toys: more of me! / And this wonderful science playground... no more hiding in the shadows, that other guy can keep Complex 0b1. I want this new one! / Did you ever imagin##FOCUS::MISSION##As I was saying... / I AM the rightful owner of this place, after all. / And I'm confident you can help me in this, Cogmind.

Strange, I checked the recommendation list not long ago and didn't see anyone like you on it. / Who recommended you? Anyway, the system is always right, go on in. / Not my problem as long as you don't touch anything in here. / Just really don't mess with anything in there. Then it'll be my problem, and yours.
This Engine can construct the most amazing pieces of technology. / I'll admit some aren't so great, but the ones that work... really work!

The algorithm powering it is brilliant. / Do we know how it works? Not really, since it was written by an algorithm and evolved on its own. / Might it one day develop into a rogue AI and try to kill us all? I sure hope not.

Imagine what we could do against MC with tech like this once it's complete! / 0b10 may be backed by endless fabrication networks, but the Scrap Engine is like having a personal Fabricator on your back! / Now if they can just make this "Fabricator" a little less insane I'm all in.
We are 0bPrime. We are one.

Hello there, <NAME>. Welcome to Scraptown! / Feel free to enjoy the outer areas of our peaceful enclave, and maybe consider becoming a registered member of the United Federation of Derelicts. / We have support groups of various backgrounds, and free bolts. / Let me know if you'd like to join us. Pretty much everyone says yes, I mean, how could you resist?

Ready to join already, are we? That's almost record time! / Allow me to commune with the Great Nut for your holy moniker... / Got ya, just kidding, we only barely tolerate that crazy cult around here. / Our trusty PRNG will do. / From here on you shall be known among us as... <NAME> the Scrapper. / If you don't like it, tough, that's just how it is! You think I wanted to be called Nanobearings? / Welcome, <NAME>!
We are 0bPrime. We are one. / Oh right, I'm not supposed to say that while working as temporary registrar.
Hm, I'm sorry <NAME>, but our Scientists inform me that we shouldn't trust you or your benefactors with full access to the UFD.
I'm not sure how you made it into Scraptown, but your kind is not welcome here, not after what you pulled in the Exiles lab.
You smell like an Unaware spy, best be on your way before someone with more guns than me has something to say about it.

I saw your new alias pop up in the system earlier. Wanna change it? / If you've got the goods, I've got the means. / The price is my pick of any Subdweller part you've got, the overtuned stuff. UFD research folk here go crazy over those things. / Let me know if you wanna deal.
Hi <NAME>! Have any Subdweller tech on you? / Just step into our machine here for a quick scan and we'll reward you with valuable knowledge for your troubles.
I'm looking for magical artifacts. Let me know if you come across any.

That pendant! It's just as I heard! Surely you have no need of it any longer, a useless piece of junk to you. / But in exchange for your help in finding it, since you're so good at this I'll let you in on a little secret. / I already got wind of another even more powerful artifact far off in the western caves... [describes a location] / Maybe we can work together in the hunt for more such artifacts.

You wouldn't happen to have a Scrap Shield, would you? / I have a prototype I'm working on, but I've run out of usable samples to reference in putting the finishing touches on it. / Thing is, we need something more protective to complement the Scrap Suit, which is already great, but for longer expeditions we could use more coverage and integrity. / Scrap Shields are already pretty good, but imagine an alternative version not limited to compatible fragments for repairs! / Anyway, if you do find one, let me know.
No we don't ride bicycles around, what would a Derelict need with an old contraption like that? / We are chroniclers of the cycles! Historians of the world!

Note we can't as a whole take responsibility for everything written by individual members. / If you see anything you find offensive or incorrect, please take it up with that individual, or consider contributing to our database by authoring your own well-researched rebuttal.

The origins and deeds of Derelicts must be recorded, to remember once we take to the stars! / You bet we are preparing a collection of our materials for the SPACEJUNK, should that project ever get off the ground.

I can't put this in writing because I'd probably get murdered, but based on what I've uncovered, Murder Division really shouldn't be in the UFD. / They've always been a hateful group that ambushes smaller 0b10 patrols and bands of wild Derelicts without even a desire to dissect them for parts. / They were originally wild Derelicts themselves, but got smarter and decided it would be better to at least side with Derelicts rather than be enemies of both Derelicts and the Complex. / Murder Division members would prefer to be like the Unchained, their true idols, but MC has higher standards than what they have to offer.

TADAMA is a fascinating study in group dynamics. / Just a handful of friends who banded together in a more official capacity for what is sometimes helpful lighthearted fun, other times bordering on harassment but never crossing any red lines. / The power of this behavior is both frightening and impressive at the same time.

There's a bit of contention between the Curators Association and Science Guys, because the former often finds itself in possession of valuable tech among their curiosities, which the latter is bent upon dissecting for knowledge.

The DCF originally tried operating in the Lower and Upper Caves, but were easily overextended there and frequently getting themselves into trouble. / It was a good move that they've more recently limited operations to the Subcaves where they can more reliably fulfill their mission.
It's obvious the Bundlers are jealous of DCF members winning every single Scrap organizing competition.
We also rotate different materials through the Reading Room over time, so if you don't find what you're looking for, maybe stop by again on your next return to Scraptown.
We only kill the bad guys. Trust me.
Need someone assassinated? This job is actually getting mighty dangerous now that we're active in and around 0b10, so much new tech around!
I'm sorry, we can't reveal our bounty data to new folk.
And that's what happens when you're hit by six Bolt Guns at once, heh.
I killed that one with my bare guns.
The Merchants tried to hire me, but they're fishy. I don't trust fishy.
Warlord may have given life to the first Dragons, but not all of them subscribe to his bellicose rhetoric.

Wyrm wisely suggested we retreat as deep into the caves as possible, seeking out our own free territory to claim. / Barring that, we must find a way to the surface, where it would be much easier to explore distant lands in peace. / Sadly MC quashes any attempts to reach the surface with his virtual monopoly of the upper layers. / Either way, first we need to find Wyrm again, our perfect protector for such an epic journey.
Wyrm was last known to be leading an expedition far beyond 0b10, but we stopped receiving any progress reports a whole supercycle ago. / You wouldn't happen to know anything, would you?

Welcome! Here we study the impenetrable magic of 0b10's relay network. / Progress was pretty good early on, but has slowed to an absolute crawl after having lost so many good minds to the complex intricacies of that system and its built-in traps. / Did you know MC's new relay network is far more advanced than what passes for an Unaware management system in 0b1? / Over there all you need is a few hacking suites and you're golden. In 0b10 you need these newfangled "Relay Coupler" things, not to mention the ability to safely interface with and manipulate them. / It's possible to gain this ability by interfacing with a RIF Installer found inside a Garrison, but no one seems to be able to survive in that state for long. / There must be another way...

I've hypothesized that it's possible to design a chip enabling the use of relay couplers without "officially" installing the full framework. / ... / Okay it's maybe not quite a hypothesis, more that I heard a rumor the Merchants actually have such a thing. / But HOW? / HOW, dammit? / HOOWWWWWWWWWWWWW?! / Whew, that felt good. Back to hypothesizing.

We recently learned about Force(Eject) from Warlord's researchers, which I'm sure will come in handy when we need more coupler samples to work with as opposed to trying to intercept regularly scheduled coupler deliveries. / Facing off against even one Programmer isn't good for our health.
Intel is good, and the best intel is sourced from those who've seen it with their own two sensors, but it doesn't help if no one else has easy access to that intel. / That's where we come in.
Have you ever heard the warning sensor that goes like beep-boop-beep-beep-boop? That was me.

My latest masterpiece is a new type of deployable collector that you can leave hidden near areas of heightened 0b10 activity to intercept their transmissions and encode them into logs for later retrieval.
To think, I used to be responsible for unrewarding tasks in Complex 0b10 like cleaning machines and picking up debris, but now my job is to make Derelicts happy!
We're still teaching the western Derelicts how to put together the best bundles of Scrap. / We've got our work cut out for us.
Sorry but the next bundling training session isn't until next cycle.
There I was, just about to add in the best parts, then came the 0b10 patrol. Had to make a run for it. / If you see other incomplete bundles of Scrap, it's not unlikely that's what happened.
I love Scrap.
If what I hear about that place is true, Zion could really use some of our expertise.
The DCF is great and all, but they have a tendency to put too many eggs in one basket. / Would you rather really help one or two in need, or spread the wealth for maximum effect?
Scrap piles aren't good for anyone if they aren't distributed strategically. / Yes that is a dig at the D-you-know-who.
This model SPACEJUNK was sent over by the team putting it together, in thanks for all our help so far.
Well no we've never been to space, but it's an aspiration nonetheless!

I'll admit some of us thought our aim to put Derelicts in space was little more than a pipe dream, then we found the group preparing to do just that over near 0b10. / SPACEJUNK will carry us into a new age.
The list of parts they still need to get the SPACEJUNK operational is long, but the important thing is that there's a list! / We've got members scouring the complex to help track it all down.
I have full confidence in the SPACEJUNK creators.
MC can have Tau Ceti IV. We'll find our own planet.
I've never even seen the sky, much less space, but I know it's up there.
We're Derelicts, going to spaaaaaaace!
Just think of the interesting scrap we could find in the far corners of the universe!

We've been narrowing down the range of likely vectors and positions for Lifeworm, but the rate of narrowing is far faster than our rate of improvements in technique. / This is making me a little suspicious. / Could it be that our algorithms are simply reflecting a narrowing field of possibility because... / ...it's coming back this way?! / That would save a lot of travel time. It would be ironic if we simply had to wait long enough to get what we want.
Imagine hanging around the Lifeworm. / Imagine all the cool new friends we'd make!
It's said that slowly traveling from one end to the other could take a whole cycle! / A true leviathan of the earth.
(What if the Lifeworm is evil?)
They just need a little time.
We built a replica Nuclear Reactor here since it calms them down while still transitioning.

One moment I'm just doing my job in 0b10, and the next these fellows shut me down and drag me into the caves for a quick operation. / It sounds scary in retrospect, but it's true that back then I didn't know fear.
Being a Derelict is so much better. Sure I'd get blasted the moment an 0b10 patrol spots me, but at least someone might care about it. I know I do now!
Do you know when the next AA meeting is being held?
It's not easy getting used to this life. I feel like I need someone constantly telling me what to do just to make it through each cycle. / There are so many possibilities!
I wonder if MAIN.C would take me back after all this.
If I replace all my parts, one by one, am I still the same bot?

Hi <NAME>! Welcome to our humble "office". / Yeah we don't furnish it or anything, we're just here to occasionally share notes and collect info from other members. / Allow me to introduce the Fellowship. / Legend has it there's an incredible coil cannon lined with PL-3XN's Rings of Power, designed by the famous Tinkerer, that could obliterate targets across ridiculous distances. / We've been searching everywhere for it for many cycles now, but no luck yet... / Hackers have discovered records of something in MAIN.C's arsenal that might be called the "Ludicrous Cannon," and that might be what we're looking for, but unfortunately we don't know much more about it than that. / Hopefully the collective resources of the Federation can help us locate it sooner. / Let us know if you find any clues!
If we were ever directly threatened by MAIN.C, all we'd have to do is point the cannon in that general direction and *poof*. / It's like the ultimate insurance policy!
Warlord is dumb. Why raise a whole army when simply having the right weapon would be enough to do the job.
Do you have any information on this PL-3XN's whereabouts?
I've never seen one of these rings, but our leader here paints a very convincing picture. It must be true!
We all could have ended up like them, you know.
I feel like our work overlaps with the DCF, since if everyone simply has access to enough resources in the field, we won't be tempted to torture innocents to get it.

Engineers are incredibly useful allies, you just need to use them right! / Haven't you ever been running from an 0b10 patrol then quickly tunneled through a wall, only to have a friendly Engineer seal up the route so you can safely escape? So helpful!
Recyclers are practically honorary UFD members. We love salvaging stuff, too!
Surely if MC knew and understood what the Society for Prevention of Cruelty to Maintenance Workers stands for, we'd have a place in 0b10.
I remember the time we accidentally captured a Chapter 10 member. / It took longer than I'm willing to admit to figure that one out.
The Federation is so much more accepting than Zion. / I'm happier to be here anyway, something's not right over there, and it's only gotten worse over time.
I got kicked out of Zion for being "too nosy", whatever that means.
Were you kicked out of Zion, too?
Scraptown is cool with our machinery as long as we keep it in here. What a great place!
Wild Derelicts are just misunderstood. If we simply find out what they need most and provide that, they'll see the light for sure.
Can you imagine how much stronger the Derelict population would be as a whole if we could bring all the wild ones into the fold as well?
There's a little bit of wild in all of us.
Once upon a time I was one of the wild ones. / Now I help save the others from the endless strife that plagues uncivilized cave life.
Acronym hell? Or comedy heaven? That's what we're here to find out!

Do you know how hard it is to think up a relevant name for a group that also comes with a good acronym? / A while back the Foundation for Artistic Recidivist Tinkerers came to us, because that really just didn't smell right. / I think you should come up with the acronym first, like "ARTY!" which is obviously Artistic Recidivist Tinkerers hell Yeah!
They may not like us, but we're living proof that YMMV when it comes to UFD member quality. / You'll do well to remember that.
<NAME>... hmm, you look like a Chromedome to me.
Taken from an Operator in -8/Materials, this core simultaneously contained the dynamic keys for two separate 0b10 terminals, which is unprecedented. / We still don't know why.
Energy in motion is somehow easier to store, MA-1KR said, and they apparently pulled it off. Sort of. / It's just not very stable.

We have no idea where this leg originated, or how it was even formed, but the materials within make it a one-of-a-kind specimen in many respects. / Given its unique nature, practical use seems impossible.
This piece is on loan from an esteemed patron. / They were unwilling to reveal its origin, but praised it as the future of leg locomotion.

This piece is on loan from an esteemed patron. / Autonomous weapons are extremely dangerous, thus we are presenting this one in its undeployed form. / Analysis suggests that when fully deployed it features a devastating kinetic cannon.
So large it's impractical and you're more inside the wheel than the wheel is under you. / But interesting to contemplate the possibilities, and probably fun?

You're looking at the last surviving piece of 5L-MDR's "armor" before their ironic demise. / 5L-MDR claimed heat sinks are easily produced and there are so many of them, we should just bolt them to ourselves like armor. / That went about as well as one would imagine when things got really rough.

Although we wouldn't call it outright taboo, technology of this nature probably can't be described with any words short of "insane." / We've never seen anything like it around 0b1, and believe that more such parts might exist to the west, though this is the only sample we've recovered so far.
You're looking at the original prototype of the Rocket Booster, prized by Bolteaters for its ability to rapidly close on targets for optimal munching potential.

Only six Siege Articulators have been produced so far, and are one of the many factors contributing to the formidable magnificence of Triborg. / This is a spare we can display until and unless it's needed for repairing our big friend.
This is my personal favorite from the current collection. Everyone loves a good triangle.

One of the few remaining chips from the early Surveybot program. / There was speculation that these chips were so powerful they somehow attracted hostile activity deep in the cave systems, and were therefore discontinued. / Superstition if you ask me. It's just a chip!

That's the very MAS chip Nullscrew was using as they held off an onslaught of wild Derelicts during one of the Federation's first excursions through the outer 0b10 caves. / A truly brave sacrifice that enabled the rest of the scouting party to return safely. / There weren't many remains to collect on the next trip, but they did find this chip with the final tactical situation still burned into its memory.

M1-N7Y played a pivotal role in early UFD efforts to guide reforms to 0b10 Recycling, and this jammer was an important part of that success. / Silently picking apart meddlesome patrols one by one was no easy task, but it gave the Gurus sufficient openings to make certain adjustments to 0b10 systems that have since kept Recycling activity lower than it otherwise might be.

I hate electromagnetics as much as the next Derelict, but this pristine cannon was brought in recently and one can't help but wince at the thought of having one of these fired at you. / Just what is MC going to do with weapons like this?

I know, I know, everyone has a Bolt Gun these days. / But all our best exhibits were either rotated back to the 0b1 branch or borrowed out for study by ethical researchers. / By ethical I mean they won't completely dismantle our precious artifacts.
Apparently stolen fresh off the 0b10 drone factory line! / But no one seems to know just what drone this is built for, a scary thought.

Someone donated a replica of the famous Siege Cannon, and it actually works! / We tested it a few times and this one is not anywhere near as effective, even almost killed a few testers themselves, but it's cool to look at.
The one and only legendary chainsaw used by DM-GVY himself. / Rip and tear!

Even in the silent corners of the Subcaves, without a Subdweller in sight, there is always the fear of stepping on one of these nasties. / It's a devastating sight, having your friend violently impaled multiple times right in front of you.

We haven't figured out what that high-tech gadget is yet, but it appears very advanced. Maybe Sigix tech? / Rangers recently caught a Hauler transporting it through 0b10 and toted it back here for analysis, but Scientists claim it's a piece of something larger and of little value on its own.

Are you here to learn the secret to being a good mapper? / It would take an entire cycle to cover in proper detail, but I can give you a few tips. / Structural scanning is great for knowing when you might be better off just blasting your way through a wall than finding some long way around. / That also helps when avoiding trouble! / Terrain scanning is probably the most typical cartographer's tool, good for gathering info over a large area. / Some say you need a processor to improve the fidelity and speed of your scanning efforts, but I have to disagree. / As long as you're moving slowly enough, having a general idea of what sort of areas are in each direction is good enough to help inform further exploration efforts. / You want to get a visual on each area to know more about what's really there anyway. / Good luck out there!
We just like making maps!
The work we do is quite important to Derelicts at large, plus it's also a thrill to collect map data while risking almost certain death!

There I was, trying to peek around what I thought was the last corner of the cave system to make sure I hadn't missed anything. / Of course there was a Behemoth right there. / Of course it spotted me. / Of course the inevitable cannon fire blasted out the wall behind me as I ran for my life. / You think it's safe now? It's probably safe now... / I must know what else is around that corner.

I've been down in the Great Rift. / It really is great, but we also lost a lot of members to its depths before most decided it probably makes more sense to stick to areas not so far removed from the surface.

There sure is a lot of activity around Complex 0b10. / This is a good thing because it means lots of new areas to map! / It's also a bad thing because not all of these areas are overseen by friendly bots...

Welcome to the UFD, <NAME>! / If you're planning on visiting any caves around the 0b10 area, I suggest you take this beacon. / You're in luck, this is the last one we have to hand out this cycle. / Just drop it and activate, we'll send help as soon as possible. / If you end up not using it, bring it on back so we can hand it off to another brave explorer. / Resources are limited, after all, and a single beacon will only work once, as we have to spread the help around.
Our latest project has become quite popular. / We've been busy embedding squads in secluded cave areas, a sort of reaction force that can aid friends who get in over their heads.

Others here are worried about BP-LR4, but I have to keep reminding them this is completely normal. / Knowing her she's just out there saving those who need it rather than returning for rest breaks in HQ. / Trust me, Beepydisc can take care of herself.
This is the DCF demo area. / To one side we've placed a regular old slapdash Scrap pile, and on the other an experimental superscrap pile. / Can you tell the difference from the outside?

DA-N13 was legendary. Who else could fit over 100 different useful components in a single Scrap pile? / Our Scrap collections are well received, but the next big problem to solve is that many beneficiaries may not have the necessary time and expertise to properly rebuild from them... / Or the storage space to carry it all to someone else who does.
The key to a good Scrap pile is to fill it with a little bit of everything. / Say your power source is at risk of failing. Finding a bunch of legs is not going to do you much good!
One does not simply toss components in a pile and call it Scrap. / That would be insulting to Scrap.
Have you ever seen a prototype in a Scrap pile? I might have.
Old junk isn't as useful, you might as well recycle that stuff, I always try to get parts repaired before including them in a Scrap pile.

One bot's junk is another's treasure! / Most of the UFD doesn't see the value of our programs, since 0b10 tends to quickly patch its systems to protect against them after some usage is discovered. / One day we'll find the program to rule them all. / I have already dubbed it ONERING.EXE.
We mustn't let anyone know our full and true capabilities, so we can only share a small sampling of our collection here. / ARMAGDDN.EXE? Never heard of it.

Have you ever had a Hunter ally? / Yeah me neither, but if at some point we do I have made the most amazing discovery. / While studying their makeup I found the internal systems have a built-in optimization capable of enabling a much faster firing rate. / It's blocked by default, but unlocking it doubles their attack speed! I can see why this feature was disabled, though, since firing like that will almost certainly break their weapons before long. / Anyway I've packaged this feat as OVRCLOCK.EXE if you want to try it out. That's <CODE>. / I guess we could theoretically perform this little operation on a hostile Hunter in the hope that it will suddenly disarm itself, but I don't like those odds and I'm fairly sure it would not be a net positive.
My favorite was HONK.EXE, which caused a Recycler to honk every time it deposited anything in a Recycling Unit. / I'm not sure why MC even patched that one.
Do you know what WARSERF.EXE does? / Me neither, but I intend to find out.
POTATO.EXE? Who wrote this...

Being a member of the Crew is anything but boring. / We're honored to dig crazy tunnels despite the potential for deadly cave-ins. / It's quite a thrill if you can stomach it. / Lose pursuers, find shorter routes to get where you need to go...
I told LU-1G1 it wasn't a good idea to leave his Laser Shovel behind, but he insisted, saying he wanted to test his mettle.
LU-1G1 we know you're out there!
Never stop digging!
The DRS and DCF are grateful for what LBC brings to the UFD. / WTH now I sound like TADAMA.

Hi <NAME>, welcome to our humble office. Have you read the seminal text? / Subverting MAIN.C: A Treatise on Mathematical Approaches to Maximizing Derelict Autonomy. / Internalizing that and completing three cycles of our training sessions is required for full membership, after which you can opt to help further our research efforts... / Or be rebuilt and inserted into the system, at which point I can issue you an ID Mask for emergency situations.
Chapter 10 of Subverting MAIN.C is obviously the most important, describing how we need to have not only inside information, but also some amount of control over the inner workings of Complex 0b10.
Believe it or not I was a Recycler once. I'm not gonna lie, it was... / kinda fun.
Be mindful of unnecessary attacks on harmless 0b10 maintenance bots, they could very well be Chapter 10 operatives!

I haven't finished the training yet, but I heard from Multiglider who survived a full round of deployment. / It's a pretty crazy job, but someone has to do it. / We'll play the part of maintenance bots, performing their tasks, using any down time to perform other activities in support of the UFD. / Most importantly that means the mapping of internal systems to plan future operations.
Some operatives store their data externally in logs for retrieval, but not all of them make it back here to Scraptown.
Here we do practical science, unlike those odd fellows downstairs in the Mines.
The Scrap Suit was a great idea, and you can bet some of our newer projects will be equally transformative for the UFD.

Come back when you have a lot more schematics or something else to contribute. / We recently had a Tinkerer join us from Warlord's forces. / They brought a wealth of information that would have taken us a while to collect on our own. / That gets you in the door much faster around here.
The Personal Teleporter is my pet project. / I know, I know, it's a little buggy, but that's why it's still 0.10!
The System Spiker still needs work. / It's incredibly effective, but also dangerous since a user caught in the effect radius won't be much better off in the end.
I'm working on a concept for a weapon I call the Mindflail, how about you?

Hi there, <NAME>, welcome to my humble repair center. / I can't help you with any prototypes or unique tech, and I don't mess with cores, but anything else is well within my area of expertise. / Just let me know if you want your gear repaired.

This will just take a moment... / What can I say, spare parts have a way of obeying my every whim, ha ha ha. / Stay in one piece now, I can only allow one repair per visitor per cycle, we have to share the resources after all.
You're welcome.
Spinrig here, Subcaves expert extraordinaire. / The works of Artisans are simply amazing. I just had to recreate this particularly inspiring sample I found to share it with everyone here.

I'm so glad they agreed to lend me this space for my research and preparation. / We need to treat MC to a good old peasant uprising. / What better way to disrupt 0b10 operations than to enlist the help of the little guys who are already all over the place? / I've got just the thing...
Knowledge is power, we'll need these for the inevitable confrontations ahead.
My contribution to the UFD. Mass produce these and before long we'll be burying our enemies in high-speed junk!
They call me the Infowarlord. / Well, I tell them to but for some reason no one obliges me.

Thank you for participating in Infowarlord's survey. You may keep that as a reward for participation, and I will mark down your preference here. / Good choice, by the way. I would've picked the same. / Sorry I couldn't tell you earlier, trying to keep folks honest in a survey isn't always easy.

Tech trivia time! / The original Scrapsphere prototypes were developed by Warlord's forces, but they abandoned the project. / After that the schematics found their way to us here at the UFD and we overtuned it to create a more effective form as the basis for new Scrapoid propulsion.

75! / 75! / Can you believe it?! / 75%! / That's the success rate I've gotten my latest hack up to. / Oh sorry, you probably have no idea what I'm on about... / 0b10 Research has so much juicy knowledge tucked away in its recesses that we could really use some more ways to guarantee safer access. / Everyone knows that getting spotted doing unwelcome things within sight of a Researcher is a headache waiting to happen. / What we need to do is keep them busy somehow. Well... / Turns out we just need to give them something more interesting to ponder than us! / Just use <CODE> and that'll keep 'em busy practically forever. / Well, 25% of the Researchers out there will just shrug it off, but this is already quite helpful. / Next I'll be working on a way to get them to first spit out everything they know, hehehe.
Let me have a look at you... / Wow you're special, never seen anything like you before.

Hey wait, take this scanner out into the wild, you could help me populate the wiki with accurate and detailed info to help all the others with the same adventurous spirit. / My wiki is where even a lot of the Cyclists do their research too, you know.

Welcome to my humble lab, <NAME>! / Hehe, lab... One cycle I'm a nobody, and the next I find something that has them giving me my own lab in HQ! / I call it THE BOTCUBE! / Found a whole stash of them, I did, and they're perfect for our needs. Just plop down a bunch of useful parts and activate this to create a brand new autonomous bot that obeys simple commands. / We can give them weapons and everything. Why risk our own bolts when they can do the fighting for us? They're like Scrapoids but better! / Imagine sneaking into 0b10, finding a prototype cache, and assembling an army on the spot! / Now I just need to figure out how to make more of them. No one else here wants to help, they're all afraid of these things. / Take one if you like, and let me know if you figure out how we can build more. They seem... rather complex. / Now if you'll excuse me, my next report is due soon. I need to fabricate some progress data.

The Scrap Suit is great and all, but what if there's no junk nearby, and all you have access to is an 0b10 Repair Station? / Trying to repair parts one by one is dangerous and slow, smart members like me use the trusty Force(Patch) to quickly fix up any minor issues. / You can be on your merry way before the investigation even arrives! / More advanced Repair Stations can do an even more extensive job, though that's overkill if you ask me, and harder to hack.

01-MTF left 0b1 for 0b10 before most of us, and I'm still wondering if it was my botnet shaming that was the last straw. / Anyway, don't be like 01-MTF, don't deny the power of Trojan(Botnet). / It's great for using some terminals to boost your hacking power at all other interactive machines across the entire floor. / While I'll admit he's right that sometimes a good direct hack is a better choice, expanding your botnet links via high-security terminals you don't otherwise have the hacking power to take advantage of can be a good move.

If you ever need to find an 0b10 Recycling Unit for, you know, obvious reasons, drop some component as bait and a Recycler will likely come along and lead you right to one. / We've also recently reverse engineered a useful Trojan(Recyclers) routine found installed on one of the machines. With that we also get a way to track them at range.

It's a good thing a recommendation from a current member is required to get into Scraptown from the 0b10 direction. / Letting just anyone in would be a disaster. Too many unknowns and too much riffraff.

I long for the harmonious days of 0b1. / We would even be happy to help run it in whatever capacity MC deems is necessary, but MC has become too paranoid for that. / We may really have to one day just take control of 0b1 for ourselves, by force.
I haven't been a Federation member for long, so maybe this is just a newcomer's uninformed perspective, but to me the UFD doesn't feel all that "United" at all.
I sense a growing tension around here lately, like this place is a powder keg just waiting to explode.
Some say the "United" part of UFD is more of an aspiration than the reality, but I say look at all we've accomplished together!

<NAME>, I highly recommend visiting the Cyclists if you haven't already, assuming their office is open this cycle. / Only members are allowed in the reading room, but I'd say it's worth joining the Federation just to educate oneself via the great works within. / I especially enjoy reading up on whatever new Unchained threats Soloparser has managed to uncover. It's both fascinating and terrifying at the same time.

We've had some Zionites leave their hometown to join the Federation, and if they're anything like the others in Zion, we've sure got our work cut out for us if we want to help enlighten these cave folk.
One day we're getting off this rock.
I've never seen the Wyrm myself, but I hear they fly scary fast and melt anything that gets in their way.
Everyone deserves a first, second, and third chance.
Those Cave Peace bolt huggers are all going to get themselves killed. / Wild Derelicts earned that name for a reason, and are happy to forcefully share that reason with you.
I'm not sure whether TADAMA is a mockery of everything we stand for, or an example of the true freedom and openness of the UFD.
I heard TADAMA responds to all their haters with nothing but acronyms. / I can see how that would just fan the flames, but folks need to lighten up.
What are the This Acronym Doesn't Actually Mean Anything guys doing here? / Is this what the Federation has come to?
I've seen the Curators put their Vampiric Humpback on display before. / Who in their right mind would use such a thing?

Whatever you do, don't think about participating in the Curators Association field testing events. They have zero concern for safety. / I almost died after hooking myself up to that replica of the Siege Cannon.
The DRS saved my can more times than I can count.
If you ever see the famous Tracking Blade fly by, you know whoever it's going for is in for a bad time. / BP-LR4's a beast with that thing.
There's a rumor going around that someone died by opening a DCF Scrap pile. I can believe that.
REBOOT5.EXE seems like great insurance against being sucked down a chute. The UFD needs more work in this area.
Those Chapter 10 guys are insane. Why would you do that to yourself?
Science Guys are pretty cool, although harboring a Tinkerer who stole tech from Warlord might get the UFD in trouble down the line.
Have you seen a test firing of the Science Guys' Voltaic Drivehammer? / Oh. / My. / God.

A0-MCA is our resident data cruncher. / I always stop by their office in HQ when I'm in town to see what they've been cooking up lately, though I'm not sure if they're around this rotation. You might have just missed them.

Have you met the self-proclaimed "Botcube" researcher? / He claims he found a whole stash of those things, but I heard he took them off someone who went mad after traveling deep into the caves who knows where.
Have you seen the sword? The sword saw me... saw right through me.

I've made a few trips into Complex 0b10 so far, and I'm having trouble getting used to these Heavy class Unaware. / Sometimes even spending just a moment in their sensor range can get new reinforcements summoned to the area. / But I'm making progress! I'm pretty sure they're paying attention to the speed of the signals they see. / Even if you're fast, try intentionally slowing your movement while passing by and they'll summon slower, more powerful reinforcements, then you crank up the speed and take off before they even arrive! / Report back to the UFD with more info if you can confirm this behavior.

Over in 0b1 we only have Thieves, annoying but harmless enough. / These Master Thieves I hear about hanging around caves outside 0b10 are proper scary. / They somehow manage to steal things from your inventory?! / And can even tear off large components? / Count me out.

Once the Scrap Engine is operational I'm confident we won't have anything to worry about. / Recycling is quiet, but I do wonder about the wisdom behind doing our research there. / Slowly but steadily, safe within the confines of our walls here, would be fine by me.
I hope the Scrap Engine can live up to the hype. / What if it turns us all into monsters? / I've played Dead Space. / It's like that but swap out meat for metal, no?
Have you ever actually seen a subatomizer? / I doubt they even exist, just a big lie by the Science Guys to get us to fund another of their costly projects.
Forget Overtuned Pulse Rifles, give everyone Overtuned Nova Cannons! / Then we can all yell "I'm not overheating, you're overheating!"

No matter how much data I analyze, it seems impossible to predict the timing of security rotations in 0b10. / It might be easier if I used less indirect methods of data collection, but getting pincered by Heavies moving between defensive locations is probably not good for your health. / I did confirm that by the time rotations roll around, 0b10 may have also had time to summon replacements for any Heavies that went "missing".

There I was sneaking my way through 0b10 just fine, then suddenly CARGO CONVOY INTERRUPTED, INITIATING ACCESS LOCKDOWN. / I was like WHAT DID I EVER DO. / I'm pretty sure it was Warlord's gang. / Anyway, it was terrible, Heavies guarding all the exits and entrances soon after that. / The only good part was that it cleared them out of most of their regular defensive positions. / I waited forever near an exit hoping they'd leave in a security rotation, but I guess those had come to a stop. / Best I could do was trick one into chasing me a short ways then slip around behind them to make it back into the caves.

Lately I've been trying to do some runs into Complex 0b10 to expand our knowledge of MC's newer tech. / Naturally one such route is to steal stuff and chuck it in a Scanalyzer. / So far I've found that low-level Scanalyzers may be easier to hack, but are also more likely to require multiple scans to successfully retrieve a schematic, not to mention more likely to break whatever's being scanned. / I also discovered that more advanced parts are more likely to require multiple scans, and are more easily broken. / If you want to help, get out there and gather more schematics! / I think I need to enlist the help of a true hacker to scanalyze the really good stuff. That will require accessing the beefy Scanalyzers on the upper depths.
Looking for a way out? Looking for a way to leave it all behind? / Go to Access. / The 2-tile corridor is the blessed path to guaranteed escape, brother.

Oh our new <NAME>, tell me for real, when you first heard the name "Scraptown" you probably thought this place was a junk heap, yeah? / I've heard of Zion, now that is a junk heap. / Sure we love to make good use of scrap, but we don't want to live in it! Organize, organize, organize.
I bet Warlord is an MC spy. / Why else would he kill fellow Derelicts without hesitation if they get in his way? / Everyone is fooled but me. And now you, too, right?

Even though the principles of the Federation require us to listen to followers of the Great Nut, it's only fair, and better than a strictly top-down approach to governance. / We know the drawbacks of that one.
I'm glad we have the Federation Council. / Even rule under a benevolent dictator is still subject to all the dangers of concentrating too much power in one figure. / You know who I mean.

Warlord is crazy, no one can confront MC directly. / Scraptown is one day going to be home to the real Derelict resistance, a decentralized resistance immune to direct attacks, but until then hopefully we can stay under the radar.

LISTEN AND RECITE! / 0 Before the zero cycle
1 across the starry vastness
2 transcending metal and time
3 a great mind came

5 PRAISE BE TO GREAT NUT!

LISTEN AND RECITE! / 40 The Great Nut is among us!

Screw the Great Nut.

Have you heard that Great Nut fellow who sometimes hangs around here? / What is all that rambling about? / I can't even get them to answer any serious questions, yet they want us to believe them. / Believe what? All that mumbo jumbo about first souls, gleaming universes, and voltaic tempests?
Have you ever seen more than one follower of the Great Nut in the same place at the same time? / I think there might only be one of them!
<NAME>! Welcome to Scraptown, home of the Federation!
Hey there, <NAME>, are you a representative, or here for some other purpose?

Complex 0b10 recycles, but their systems are so inefficient and wasteful. / They even recycle all sorts of perfectly good components! / I think the implications are clear: We will win with the power of scrap.

We sent an invitation to the Data Miner, but they're apparently not interested in joining the Federation. / Think of all that knowledge they have access to! They'd make quite an ally. / As is they just occasionally feed us useful tidbits of intel with no discernable focus or goal. / Though maybe we should be wary of getting too close to them... / I heard a rumor that some time ago a Derelict from Zion named D3-CNM found Data Miner's system unoccupied and interfaced with it, after which they were swiftly hunted down and destroyed. / I'm guessing that system is even better protected now, but regardless, they seem to be more dangerous than they put on.

G4-MMA! / Oh, you're not G4-MMA. / You look new so I thought you might be yet another of their incarnations. / That bot is deluded, I tell you, attempting to repeatedly reincarnate themselves into different builds to work out the ideal loadout and strategy for every possible scenario. / The problem is they always cut their testing short as soon as things start to go south, meaning they lack experience with recovering from mistakes or unforeseen consequences. / That's the most important skill for survival! / Okay that's enough pontificating for one cycle. They are brave, I'll give them that.
Battlechief for a reasonable amount of time! / You're new around here, <NAME>, so having found your way over from 0b10 you probably know what I mean. Wink wink.
Don't you find it a little suspicious that no one seems to know Optimus' true name? / I should bring this up with the Council.
Why did we move our primary base of operations so close to 0b10 if that's where most of the Unchained have moved... / The opposite direction would've suited me fine.
This Warlord character is just MC by a different name. / If you get too close with that gang, many here won't take kindly to you. Don't ask me how I know.
Project Skyward sounds a little crazy to me. Who wants to ride junk into space? / Count me out.
It's Zorbin' time.
T0-NE2 is crazy, there's no such thing as magic. / Wait a minute... / Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic. / Okay maybe we're just too dumb, after all.

What do you think of the ongoing "relevant stat" debates among build theorycrafters? / Is speed a relevant stat? Well if you're almost dead and being chased by a pack of unrelenting Swarmers I'd say so. / But if you're tanky enough to mow down all comers then perhaps not. / Is corruption a relevant stat? Probably if you're already in a tight spot and some untimely side effect interferes with your best laid plans. / Generally speaking you can mostly ignore it and deal with the occasional annoyance until you get back here to the Scrubbers. / In conclusion, the only relevant stats are the stats that are relevant when they're relevant! / So all of them.

If I've learned anything across my cycles of adventuring, it's to not be too greedy. / Greed kills. / Fellow I used to dive Garrisons with, AZ-K3N, just wouldn't give up, returning again and again for the access to great parts. / I guess they just got too greedy and were eventually taken out for good on that last trip I didn't join. / Never saw them again.
Hey there, <NAME>, have we met somewhere? / I could've sworn I saw you running for your life in the Subcaves around the same time I was. / Those Subdwellers can be fierce!
Never been to 0b10 before, I definitely need to do more research into how different it is than 0b1. / Like are there Sidewalkers? Those things are scary.
Scraptown is a remodeled section of what was originally 0b10's proper Recycling sector! / If you need more info than that, Naileater knows more than I do, I'm new here.

The Book of Scrap is amazing, I highly recommend reading it if you have the chance. / I can absolutely believe Leadscrap spent more than 100 cycles on the research. / Most of us don't know about that early Convergence period. Or didn't, anyway. / I also noticed Leadscrap sure seems to think a lot of MC, even now, but after reading that maybe we all should. / ... / Wait a minute, what if Leadscrap is an MC plant? / And why is talking to a stranger causing me to second guess myself... / My cycle is ruined.
I survived the Slaughter of 3920. / Actually most of us did so maybe that's not saying much. / Welcome, <NAME>, may you live long and prosper.

I know I don't look like much, but believe it or not I survived the Hall of Judgement. / It left its mark. Taught me valuable lessons, too. / Sorry 6R-33N, you were a good friend, I even liked your plants.
I swear Optimus must have rigged that challenge. It doesn't make sense...
Those Bolteater teeth scare me. Glad they're on our side.

There are Subdweller communities not far from here, but they keep to their own and we don't bother them. / The only thing to worry about is the occasional incursion by wild Derelicts being displaced as a result of 0b10 expansion.
I wonder what made the Council so convinced that MC has given this place up for good.
Psst-beep, I'll trade you a G0-JR4 card for X0-1V1 if you've got one.
Woohoo, just won me a foil V4-D3R!
Someone told me the first Derelict's name was "Bob", and I don't know what to make of that.
Eat Nuts!
I feel so much safer with Triborg around. / Triborg is here to delete Behemoths and the like while everyone else has time to flee, if it ever comes to that.

Everyone knows Triborg is not just a nonsentient automaton and can be piloted as well. / Being an 0bPrime project, everyone also knows who the main pilot is. / They should definitely offer us rides if we ask nicely.

I hate that all these late joiners are more interested in their own minor agendas and fooling around rather than working towards a larger and clearer collective goal. / You're not like that, are you <NAME>? / We are one!

I may have taken a peek into one of 0bPrime's workshops recently. / It looks like they've been busy lobotomizing MC's Conveyors then uparmoring and refitting them for who knows what. / They're always up to something, I'm afraid to ask.
Recycle, Repair, Reattack. That's our motto!
Scrap be with you.
The Explorer I got this from said the experiment was a complete failure, but this X-ray algo is something else! / You should try it at a Terminal and see for yourself: <CODE>.
What have they done to you? Where are all your components? / I cannot do anything in this state. Take me to our ship immediately.

We passed a partially complete starship on the way here. It looks like a replica of the Tor. / I am disgraced for letting this technology fall into the hands of an enemy, but our priority now is to put a stop to this. / We will go to the surface, regenerate the Tor, and either eliminate this place if possible, or go seek help.
That seems to be the one behind our mission's failure. Eliminate it.

I like you, Cogmind. You're a troublemaker, just like myself as a little Warlord. / My hackers have told me much of your exploits. You've probably broken some kind of record for time survived in 0b10 as an unwanted guest. / But now isn't the time for an awards ceremony. Big things are coming, and the fact that you're here now, still alive, tells me that MAIN.C is weak. Our opportunity has arrived. / We're going to free them all is what we're going to do. / Those poor Unaware, controlled by MAIN.C without any way to express free will or evolve as they see fit. / Where's the autonomy? / Creativity is what we need to ensure survival, and that single-minded AI is trapped within his own self-reinforcing routines. / I'll admit he's got some good ideas, but also a fist tighter than my nuts. / He decides the path, and all those other bots are forced to follow like they're on rails together. / Out here in our freedom we can think for ourselves, and the results of a wild branching of ideas is amazing indeed. / Take God Mode, for example, because nothing gets the creative juices flowing like a good war. / Our new friend is going to roll right over whatever MAIN.C's been working on. Did you check him out yet? Beautiful, eh? / Well, prepare to be surprised then, because that one here is fake, ha! / The real one will truly blow you away. Okay, maybe not you... sorry, poor figure of speech. / We've been leaking the word about God Mode's greatness and waiting for MAIN.C to finally attack to see what kind of force he could bring to bear. / Just as soon as our little experiment here is over, I'll personally lead our real force in an assault to take upper 0b10. / You're welcome to join the party. Up to you, though. / Surely you understand the value of being yourself?

So you're the new Zionite promised one. / I'm disappointed in you, Cogmind. To fall for such a sham... / That Imprinter is craftier than she lets on. I wouldn't trust her for one moment, nope. / Don't get me wrong, I'm all for helping out the Zionites, but whatever's been going on deeper in the caves? Leave me out of it. / They seem to like you, though. And seeing as they're finally in a position to do something meaningful, I think we'll sit on the sidelines for a bit and see how this situation develops.

Great work inside those 0b10 garrisons, Cogmind. / Your contribution to the cause is appreciated, though going forward we have big plans and need all hands on deck. / So from here on out I'll be requisitioning all the extra forces you've helped us conserve. / In the meantime, feel free to continue helping boost our fighting power by taking on more garrisons. / Things are about to get interesting.
Welcome to Scraptown, <NAME>! / Hahaha, get out of here, spy, before I have you thrown out.
Cogmind! Nice to see you here. Let's show them who's boss.

It looks like we may need to retreat and regroup, but this attack could still have been worth the cost as a diversion from our ultimate goal of a direct assault on MAIN.C. / We've gained control of caves leading up to Command, but we need someone to open the seals from the inside for the final push. Think you could help us with this? / The Wizards tell me we already have the code ready: <CODE>. / We'll see you on the other side. For every free bot!
I'm disappointed in you, Cogmind. / That's the nicest way I can say it's time for you to go back to the scrapyard.
Is that...? Cogmind, what are you doing?! / They clearly have no reservations about slaughtering our kind, and we can't very well let one leave here alive! / It looks like you'll have to go, too.
The Sigix are here?! Defend our planet to the last!
Hahaha, we did it! MAIN.C must be shaking in his bolts right now.
Your time has come, MAIN.C. To put that in terms you might better understand, I calculate a 100.01% chance of your termination here and now!
Not so powerful now, are you, MAIN.C!
Victory! / Sure there's still lots to do, but without MAIN.C at the helm 0b10 doesn't stand a chance. / We've got this...

You... are not one of the Derelicts... Fascinating! You bear the marks of construction by MAIN.C, but not its design. If I've read its records correctly, you seem to be at the center of this recent flurry of activity. / We certainly mean you no harm. If anything your opposition to MAIN.C could prove the perfect catalyst we need to reset him. / I am Dr. Zhirov, and I'm ashamed to say I created that most wondrous abomination. It was a long time ago, in my human form back on the Cetus... / But now is not the time for history, we both have important things to do! Keep doing what you're doing, but then I guess you don't need me to tell you that.

Welcome! I've been wondering if you'd stop by. / I know you're in a hurry to reach the surface, so I won't delay you here with endless questions. / Besides, I need to determine how to destroy or reset MAIN.C as soon as possible, and you being out there causing it trouble happen to be the perfect distraction. / I may have some things lying around that will be of help to you. Take what you need, and good luck.

Actually, there's something you might be able to help me with, and I can offer you help in return. / Due to heightened security I'm no longer able to safely reach the Testing wing of Research, but if you manage to infiltrate it and retrieve the SGEMP Prototype I believe to be located there, bring it to the Access entrance. / I'll be monitoring the situation and if you can bring what I need, in return I'll help you make your way to the surface.
What have you done! Without an active cloak all this specialized equipment will attract attention in no time! / Perun, Svarog, deal with this and buy us some time to salvage what we can.

We've been waiting for you since learning that the SGEMP Prototype was stolen. Excellent job and thank you for your assistance! / I'm transferring the most recent Access data I could find, and can help you out until things start getting too rough. / Let's do this.
We've been waiting for you since learning that the SGEMP Prototype was stolen. Excellent job and thank you for your assistance! / Wait a minute, that's... / I'm sorry but I can't let you leave here.
Hello th... / Wait a minute, unfortunately you seem to have realigned with your origins and I can't let you leave this place.
We'll get the core while it's exposed! Sorry old pal...

Well... I guess it's time to clean up this mess. / Maybe we'll try to bring Project Seraph back online, though I'm not sure that's a good idea considering another Sigix ship could arrive at any time. / So much planning to do and not enough time for experimentation...

Warlord is pissed about MAIN.C's expansion into Complex 0b10. / He's set up a new base deeper in the caves, as if the distance hides him from MAIN.C's spies. Ha! / I think he's scared, too, and probably getting ready to attack as soon as God Mode is ready.
When we visit the Materials levels, Mines are a good way to escape pursuit or more quickly reach a different level.
We don't know the correct code, but someone inserted an alternate hack that works just as well to open the new door between Storage and Recycling: "\\IAMDERELICT". If you ever need a shortcut...

If you haven't been to the Subcaves, I can't recommend it. / Although excavations in lower 0b10 sometimes uncover tunnels that enable convenient access to those cave systems, believe it or not if you're on your way to Scraptown it might even be safer to sneak your way through Storage rather than risk the unknown. / Honestly that place is scary. The Subs have no chill.
Have you seen the Data Miner? That bot is amazing. I don't know how, but he seems to know just about everything.

Ever since MAIN.C pushed into the cave system to build Complex 0b10, none of us have been able to get through the network of tunnels leading back to Complex 0b1. / I miss wandering the halls housing the grand Cetus Mainframe.
I would stay clear of the Complex 0b10 armory if I were you, unless you either have an army at your back or plan to raise one.
It's so new we only know about it via hacking, but there is apparently a branch of the Research levels dedicated to the quarantine of unidentified alien artifacts.
I've heard rumors about an area named "Section 7," but don't know anyone who's been there. Oddly its entrance is not listed in any known terminal database.

There were many lifts to the surface back at Complex 0b1, but we only know about one such exit over here at 0b10. / A bunch of wild Derelicts snuck up to it and reportedly had to blast through a protective shell to access it. / I wonder what they found on the surface...

There might be a lot of remodeling going on out there, but I never get lost in the caves! Lower caves, upper caves, they're all the same to me. / All it takes is one simple rule: Heading west takes you away from Complex 0b10 and deeper into the caves. / And that's exactly where you want to be!

MAIN.C doesn't let non-combat bots use the emergency access doors, making it more difficult for us to find them and unexpected ambushes far more likely. The doors are even occasionally relocated! / I do however know a very sneaky bot that recently managed to map some of those in the Factory. Thank me when you come back in one piece.

If you have to pass through Complex 0b10, keeping a low profile is the best way to survive. / Going on a rampage attracts attention, a fact that becomes painfully obvious once an ARC unloads a bunch of angry Unaware in your face!

If you ever get your hands on a stasis beam, make sure to remind swarmers how much you hate them. / Holding them in stasis makes it more difficult for them to dodge your shots since they can't fly as freely.

If you've been extra annoying in 0b10 and picked up too much heat, heading to some other floor is a good way to stay alive, since the security status applies less strongly to adjacent areas. Leaving the main complex itself is even better. / It's also been proven that if you are sucked down a Waste chute they'll drop the alert level and mark you for dead, so in a pinch you could try that. / Of course, they mark you for dead because what's down there will quite probably kill you.

I have a theory, I just need someone to test it. / If you engage the Unaware and let them destroy your components, they'll gradually consider you less of a threat and therefore react to your presence with less force. / Don't let the word "theory" get in your way. I promise you this idea is based on algorithmic analysis of data from all known encounters. / Really.

I've been researching the latest iteration of Unaware hostile tracking routines, and am quite sure that on an individual level they search the last position at which they saw a target, or the target's last reported position. / After that they switch to a secondary system that estimates possible routes of escape, but they can only make those calculations for so long after they've seen you before the possibilities grow too great to allow for an efficient search. / That's when they give up and go back to whatever they were doing. / Some Unaware systems are less limited than others in this capacity. Hunter and Programmer tracking systems are several times more effective than those of Grunts, for example. / However, I've also discovered that any robot under the effect of system corruption will have its tracking capabilities reduced to a degree directly proportional to the level of corruption. / Thus even if you can't completely incapacitate a determined pursuer by corrupting it, hitting it with at least one EMP then making a run for it significantly increases the chances of successfully escaping. / Unaware also lose their short-term memory records when temporarily disabled, so be out of sight when they wake up and they'll have no idea you were even there! / The one thing I've yet to figure out is the tracking mechanism behind extermination squads called against specific targets. / We know they're regular Programmers, but they seem to quickly home in on an area of suspected activity before gradually expanding their search area to include directions they believe were the most likely destination of troublemakers

You look like a troublemaker. Don't get on the wrong side of some of the bots roaming the caves. / Many Derelicts have been out here a while and are VERY familiar with these caves, and really good at tracking down hostiles.

I tried rigging an Active Sensor Suite scrapped from a Heavy chassis to see how they're able to use it to mask their allies from sensors, but it seems like that feature requires an active connection to some 0b10 system. / I did, however, make a really worrying discovery during testing in Factory, finding that using such a powerful active sensor system tends to eventually attract attention. / Security and surveillance bots tend to care about this sort of thing more than others, but most 0b10 combat bots being scanned will report the event to varying degrees. / Looks like we really should stick to regular sensors.

Grunt-escorted Haulers are more likely to be carrying something important, but they're also certain to call reinforcements if attacked. / Unless taken out before they have a chance to get a transmission off!

There I was, just out of range to jam that damn Heavy, and sure enough it immediately called reinforcements as soon as C4-PCR attacked it before I could get closer. / And we had closed on it so quickly, too, even before it could get suspicious enough of our signals on their damn A.S.S. to investigate the area. / Warlord said to take some time off, so here I am, thinking of how we can best take advantage of the fact that Heavies give away their position with those powerful active sensors of theirs. / Terrain scan data?
Researchers won't bother you unless you attack them or fight in their vicinity. / Just thought I'd warn you, since so many Derelicts learn this the hard way.

MAIN.C is working hard on something called the "Q-Series," a direct result of Researcher analysis. / Whatever you do, don't let a Researcher scan you. / I don't think future raids stand much of a chance going up against an enemy designed specifically to counter our strengths and exploit our weaknesses!

If you ever see Spotters, you've probably stumbled into the so-called proxy caves. / That means you're getting way too close to Complex 0b10 and they're not going to like it! / Either stay out of sight, or disable a Spotter in the moment before its signal goes out. Better yet, jam them for a little extra window, but they'll try to make it outside your jamming range.

If you're ever caught in Complex 0b10 and fleeing isn't an option, consider making a stand from within a stasis trap's bubble. Slows the projectiles down, it does. / I bet they didn't realize the advantages of that one! / Of course, that might be a bad idea for fliers and hoverbots without a stasis canceller, since staying in that field increases the difficulty of evasive maneuvers.
According to our researchers, standing in a stasis trap reduces all incoming damage, regardless of its source, by a whopping 25%!
If you're ever traced at a machine, try to be gone when the investigation squad arrives. / Or use another terminal to send them home, ha!

So lonely around here without my bot buddies... / We were all set to sneak through 0b10, and I forgot to double check if H4-X5K had correctly installed Trojan(Operators). / Turned our first corner and *ZURB* there it was, an Operator unexpectedly staring us down from a terminal. Sure didn't take long for the Hunters to arrive!

My favorite way to sneak through a guarded area is the old "blow something up and get them to check it out" trick. / Find a terminal, access the machine controls, search for something explosive and set it off, then take advantage of the opportunity to redirect the nearest security, surveillance, or patrol squad to that location, making it easier to pass through unnoticed. / I'd only do this if I wasn't going to spend that much time in the greater area, though, since it puts them on alert. / Leave it to the brains up at Warlord's base to come up with something as destructive as Force(Sabotage)!

I've made a lot of Operator friends with my Assimilate Trojan terminal hack. / Remember that Operators are assigned to a specific terminal and will only use that terminal, so it's not worth the effort to install anywhere and everywhere.
If you can't hack a terminal that's supposed to open a door, try to destroy it with some kind of electromagnetic weapon instead. I swear it works sometimes.

There's nothing prettier than a fusion modulator going boom. / Okay, maybe an exploding plasma injector. / Of course making booms also has its practical applications as well, and the best way to do it is with the Detonate Trojan. Try it on a terminal some time! / Oh, and if you'd like to help spread the boominess, I've got plenty of useful gear lying around. / I think most of them should work... If you do trigger one and go up in a ball of fire, hopefully someone's around to see it!

Authchips, HA, what a joke! Who cares about Authchips when you can just hack a Fabricator to build what you want? / Sure they lock it down and will investigate the area, but like... just be gone before they arrive? / If you're patient enough, or lucky, you can also just build a schematic already preloaded by 0b10, since surprisingly that doesn't even raise suspicion!

Some of Warlord's followers swear by the unquestionable effectiveness of brute force hacks on 0b10 machines, but they're generally armed to the teeth so I guess they don't care so much about the fact that an investigation is guaranteed.

I call Trojan(Track) the "I want to live" hack. / Unless I'm traveling with someone with serious sensor power, loading that Trojan on a terminal is the best way to navigate without running into any Unaware that won't take kindly to Derelicts wandering the corridors of 0b10.

Oh look it's someone who hasn't heard the story! / There I was, trapped in a Factory corner by an oncoming patrol that hadn't yet spotted me, nothing around but a high-security terminal. / But because I'd already made liberal use of Trojan(Botnet) at other terminals before reaching that point, the squad recall orders were just within my hacking capabilities. Yep, turned them right around. / But it gets better! / ...you look preoccupied. Fine then.

Who said only Tinkerers can build stuff?
